subject: Iditarod Trail Sled Dog Race (Alaska)
Dog Sledding
lead_paragraph: The competitive portion of the 1,100-mile Iditarod Trail Sled Dog Race started Sunday with Cim Smyth of Big Lake leaving the restart first in Willow, Alaska. The defending champion, Lance Mackey of Fairbanks, was fifth. Mackey is fresh off a close victory in the 1,000-mile Yukon Quest International Sled Dog Race, considered by many to be an even tougher race. Last year, Mackey became the first to win the Quest and the Iditarod.
